com.adobe.webserver

Class ServerMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adobe.webserver.ServerMain

  • public class ServerMain
extends Object
    It helps you start the server. It contains the main method, so you can start your server directly by this class. you can also use the methods of this class to start the webserver from some other class In case you want to start the server from some other class, call following methods in sequence 1. init - Initializes Server with Properties.xml file 2. start - starts the server 3. stop - stops the server
    Author:
    khemka

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(File propertiesFile)
          throws FileNotFoundException,
                 InvalidPropertiesFormatException,
                 IOException
        this method initializes the webserver properties. It does this initialization with properties file. If you don't provide some property value in properties.xml, it will take the corresponding default value
        Parameters:
        propertiesFile - File object denoting the properties file
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException
        InvalidPropertiesFormatException
        IOException

      • start

        public void start()
        starts the server according to properties read in init method.

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws InterruptedException
        stops the server. waits till the server is stopped before returning.
        Throws:
        {@link - InterruptedException} if the thread is interrupted
        InterruptedException

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        it initializes and then starts the server. and waits for input from console As soon as user enters 'e' , it stops the server
        Parameters:
        args - ignored
